alert.note: Alert for Mercer (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 6:09PM EDT until July 15 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Mercer County in central New Jersey... East Central Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 1015 PM EDT. * At 609 PM EDT, Local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. Numerous reports of flooding and water rescues also. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Trenton, Ewing, Pennington, Yardley, Newtown, Washington Crossing, Woodside, Lawrenceville, Woodbourne, and Newtown Grant. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 69 and 76. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
